column4: i've installed teamspeak server on ubuntu 10.04 server, i think the config is ok, when i do a netsat i get: http://pastebin.com/L2Spe0zm
i've tried tcpdump while trying to connecto with the client and i get several like these: 17:12:52.505512 IP xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.51045 > xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.51234: UDP, length 160
thanks, i did exactly that, and the server is up and running, i need to find why i can't connect with the client
can you telnet to the socket?
that's good, so its not firewall stopping it etc, what OS are the clients?
i can telnet from windows too
was afraid you'd say that, does the client keep a log of what happens when you try to connect?
kinda... <18:07:19> Failed to connect to server
anything else intelligent or is it dumb like most other windows apps
yeah thought so, I hate windows apps. They give zero feedback
try a linuix client, it may have verbose logging and be actually useful
